body_content.explanation: (of a meal) involving more than one course (= separate part of the meal):
examples: The family enjoyed a leisurely, multi-course dinner.
A multicourse lunch can cost more than $50.

body_content.explanation: involving or relating to more than one course of study:
examples: The curriculum is designed for multi-year, multi-course study.
The company was invoiced in advance for multi-course training packages before employees had attended the full number of courses available.

body_content.explanation: involving the teaching of a subject for more than one qualification in the same class:
examples: Teachers in some Scottish schools have to do multi-course teaching in which they teach at National 4, National 5 and Higher at the same time.
The issue of multicourse classes will be an issue for discussion at the upcoming conference.

body_content.explanation: using or consisting of several different golf courses (= areas of land for playing golf):
examples: The Northern Emirates Open is a new multi-course tournament.
If you want to experience playing at lots of different golf courses in an area, why not book one of our multi-course tours?
